message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CY

This paper deals with natural language processing tasks such as fact checking, document retrieval, source credibility, stance detection, and rationale extraction. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with the intersection of computer science and linguistics. The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) techniques for retrieving relevant documents, which makes cs.IR (Information Retrieval) another likely sub-category. The use of machine learning algorithms for predicting the factuality of claims and aggregating the strength of stances suggests cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as another possible sub-category. The paper also involves the use of probabilistic models for decision-making, which is a common theme in cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with Arabic language processing, which makes cs.CY (Computational Linguistics and Natural Language Processing) another possible sub-category.
